results.title: Log drive
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In words and music this 1957 film brings to the screen a great seasonal event of the Quebec spruce forest - the log drive. A ballad singer comments musically on this annual spectacle. Water-borne, the vast aggregation of logs moves downstream, spurred by dynamite and sharp-tipped cant hooks, tossed and twirled by the boots of leaping men.

results.title: Locomotion on the ocean
results.brief_description: The way a seacreature moves has a lot to do with it’s lifestyle. As we travel through the different levels in the ocean - from surface to seafloor - we learn that an animal’s habitat helps to determine how they move - predators and prey have adapted to particular needs and locations. For example drifters, such as jellyfish, move with the current and crawlers such as crayfish and sea stars move on the ocean floor. Also investigates the anatomical features of each animal and how they determine the means of locomotion. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Locomotion
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Jones, British Transport Films and Geoffrey Jones Films
results.brief_description: Documentary celebrating 100 years of British railway history and the opening of the world’s first steam hauled public railway, the Stockton and Darlington Line. Its first engine became known as “Locomotion”. Uses collections of prints and sketches of people and architectural sights from a variety of museums and archival and picture libraries in the United Kingdom.

results.brief_description: Meet Mark and Tanya the owners of the Lockington Hotel and share a night with the Lockington and Kotta and Rochester Instrumentalists (LAKARI) as they entertain the locals.

results.title: Lockington Living Heritage Complex
results.brief_description: Celebrating and preserving the rich history of Lockington and its surrounding district, the dedicated and hard working volunteers of the Lockington Living Heritage Complex take us on a tour of the complex with the highlight being ‘The Big Shed’ which at 106 metres houses a restored Melbourne tram and the first ever pop top caravan, hand built in Lockington.

results.title: Lockington Film Premiere: ACMI in the Regions
results.brief_description: In July 2008, the ACMI Content Development crew spent four days in Lockington and produced five short documentary films. The premier screening of these short films took place on the 15th of January 2009, on a hot and humid Thursday evening in the Lockington & District Community Centre. Over 200 locals joined Tony Sweeney and Kim Montgomery, from ACMI, and Louise Ross, a local and chief community organiser, to showcase the films and celebrate the stories that make Lockington a thriving and unique regional town. This film of the premiere screenings captures the excitement of the locals with a red carpet arrival for all the guests, the handing out of DVDs to all individuals that were involved in the project and finally vox pops from the audience members as they share with us their appreciation and pride for the films.

results.title: Locking devices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Starts by showing diagrammatically the effect of vibration on a nut and bolt to draw attention to the necessity for some way of preventing the nut coming undone. Various devices for this purpose are demonstrated.

results.title: Lock, stock and two smoking barrels [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Guy Ritchie, Matthew Vaughn, Ska Films and Summit Entertainment
results.brief_description: When four small time London cons pool their savings for a high-rolling illegal card game with local crime boss Hatchet Harry, things don’t quite go as confidently anticipated. The four friends end up owing him half a million pounds with only a week to pay it off under threat of systematic loss of fingers if they fail to do so. As they engage in robbery, deception and double crossing involving their criminal next door neighbours, powerful drug barons and Harry himself to get the money, circumstances spiral surrealistically out of their control. The situation is further complicated by confusion over two valuable antique guns that Hatchet Harry has purchased, and which are mistakenly directed for use in pulling a ‘job’. The four hapless friends muddle through the seedy underside of London and an unwittingly created gang war in a collection of comic moments and misunderstandings balanced seamlessly with more serious elements. This is a tightly structured film with a cleverly twisted plot and striking rhythmic visuals and editing that, combined with the soundtrack, can be likened to the best of music videos. Cast includes Jason Flemyng, Dexter Fletcher, Nick Moran, Jason Stratham and Steven Mackintosh.

results.title: Loch Lomond
results.creator_credit: Laurence Henson, Films of Scotland and IFA (Scotland)
results.brief_description: A study of human and wild life throughout the year, in, on, and around Loch Lomond. Gives a picture of the life and work of a Highland community - the wild life conservator, research biologist, shepherd, farmer and publican, all of whom know the Loch in its many moods.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Henson, Films of Scotland and IFA (Scotland)
